intro: Bullockia impressinervia, commonly known as the narrow-veined bullockia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has simple, opposite leaves with prominent veins, which contribute to its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical forests. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some regions for horticultural purposes.
